result.markdown:
---
title: "Parkinson’s Telemonitoring"
author: Chenxi Lin
date: 2025-07-28
---



About this site

# Introduction
This dataset is composed of a range of biomedical voice measurements from 42 people with early-stage Parkinson's disease recruited to a six-month trial of a telemonitoring device for remote symptom progression monitoring. The dataset includes various acoustic features such as average vocal fundamental frequency, jitter, shimmer, and harmonic-to-noise ratio, as well as two clinical outcome scores: motor UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) and total UPDRS, which are standardized measures used to assess the severity and progression of Parkinson’s symptoms. The primary goal of this analysis is to investigate how voice features relate to disease severity and to develop predictive models that estimate UPDRS scores based on these vocal biomarkers.

## Data source
The dataset was created by Athanasios Tsanas (tsanasthanasis@gmail.com) and Max Little (littlem@physics.ox.ac.uk) of the University of Oxford, in collaboration with 10 medical centers in the US and Intel Corporation who developed the telemonitoring device to record the speech signals. The original study used a range of linear and nonlinear regression methods to predict the clinician's Parkinson's disease symptom score on the UPDRS scale.

http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Parkinsons+Telemonitoring

## Reference
A Tsanas, MA Little, PE McSharry, LO Ramig (2009)'Accurate telemonitoring of Parkinson's disease progression by non-invasive speech tests', IEEE Transactions on Biomedical 

# Load the packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(tidymodels)
library(knitr)
```
:::




# Load dataset


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data <- read.csv("Parkinsons-Telemonitoring-ucirvine.csv")

# turn the character "false"/"true" into a factor with labels
data <- data %>%
  mutate(gender = factor(sex, levels = c("false", "true"), labels = c("Female", "Male") ))
```
:::



# 1. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

### 1.1.1 Summarize by group


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# compute count, mean & SD of key variables by gender
summary_by_gender <- data %>%
  group_by(gender) %>%
  summarise(
    n                  = n(),                                # sample size
    age_mean           = mean(age,           na.rm = TRUE),  # average age
    age_sd             = sd(age,             na.rm = TRUE),  # age SD
    total_updrs_mean   = mean(total_updrs,   na.rm = TRUE),  # avg total UPDRS
    total_updrs_sd     = sd(total_updrs,     na.rm = TRUE),  # SD total UPDRS
    motor_updrs_mean   = mean(motor_updrs,   na.rm = TRUE),  # avg motor UPDRS
    motor_updrs_sd     = sd(motor_updrs,     na.rm = TRUE)   # SD motor UPDRS
  )

# print a quick view
print(summary_by_gender)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 8
  gender     n age_mean age_sd total_updrs_mean total_updrs_sd motor_updrs_mean
  <fct>  <int>    <dbl>  <dbl>            <dbl>          <dbl>            <dbl>
1 Female  4008     65.1   7.85             29.7          11.0              21.5
2 Male    1867     64.3  10.6              27.5           9.85             20.9
# ℹ 1 more variable: motor_updrs_sd <dbl>
```


:::
:::




## 1.2 Visualize distributions & outliers of total UPDRS


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#  Histogram of total UPDRS
ggplot(data, aes(x = total_updrs)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Total UPDRS", x = "Total UPDRS", y = "Count")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Density plot of total UPDRS by gender
ggplot(data, aes(x = total_updrs, fill = gender)) +
  geom_density(alpha = 0.4) +
  labs(
    title = "Density of Total UPDRS by Gender",
    x     = "Total UPDRS",
    y     = "Density")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Violin + boxplot of motor UPDRS by gender
ggplot(data, aes(x = gender, y = motor_updrs, fill = gender)) +
  geom_violin(trim = FALSE, color = "black") +
  geom_boxplot(width = 0.1, outlier.shape = NA,
               color = "black", size = 1.2) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Female" = "rosybrown2", "Male" = "lightblue")) +
  labs( title = "Motor UPDRS Distribution by Gender",
    x = "Gender",
    y = "Motor UPDRS") +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 16),   # x‐axis title size
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16),   # y‐axis title size
        axis.text.x  = element_text(size = 12),   # x‐axis tick labels
        axis.text.y  = element_text(size = 12),   # y‐axis tick labels
        legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Boxplot for age vs. total UPDRS
ggplot(data, aes(x=factor(age), y=total_updrs)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill='lightgreen') +
  labs(title='Age vs. Total UPDRS', x='Age', y='Total UPDRS') +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=0))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::




## Boxplot for age vs. total UPDRS


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data, aes(x = gender, y = motor_updrs, fill = gender)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Motor UPDRS by Gender",
       x = "Gender", y = "Motor UPDRS") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# 2. Correlation and Regression Analysis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Correlation matrix
cor_matrix <- cor(data[, c("age", "motor_updrs", "total_updrs", "jitter", "shimmer", "nhr", "hnr")])
print(cor_matrix)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                     age motor_updrs total_updrs      jitter     shimmer
age          1.000000000  0.27366476  0.31028993  0.02307118  0.10155386
motor_updrs  0.273664760  1.00000000  0.94723131  0.08481576  0.10234870
total_updrs  0.310289929  0.94723131  1.00000000  0.07424667  0.09214091
jitter       0.023071181  0.08481576  0.07424667  1.00000000  0.70979112
shimmer      0.101553856  0.10234870  0.09214091  0.70979112  1.00000000
nhr          0.007092699  0.07496727  0.06095164  0.82529366  0.79515848
hnr         -0.104842069 -0.15702858 -0.16211683 -0.67518824 -0.80141600
                     nhr        hnr
age          0.007092699 -0.1048421
motor_updrs  0.074967270 -0.1570286
total_updrs  0.060951644 -0.1621168
jitter       0.825293655 -0.6751882
shimmer      0.795158485 -0.8014160
nhr          1.000000000 -0.6844119
hnr         -0.684411857  1.0000000
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Visualize correlation matrix
library(corrplot)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
corrplot 0.95 loaded
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
corrplot(cor_matrix, method="color", type="upper", tl.cex=0.8)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](project_title_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Linear Regression model: Predicting Total UPDRS using jitter and shimmer
lm_model <- lm(total_updrs ~ jitter + shimmer, data=data)
summary(lm_model)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = total_updrs ~ jitter + shimmer, data = data)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-26.365  -7.332  -1.519   7.553  26.337 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  27.6897     0.2321 119.312  < 2e-16 ***
jitter       33.9171    35.0935   0.966    0.334    
shimmer      32.9216     7.6397   4.309 1.66e-05 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 10.66 on 5872 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.008648,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.00831 
F-statistic: 25.61 on 2 and 5872 DF,  p-value: 8.424e-12
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Multiple Linear Regression including age and sex
multi_lm <- lm(total_updrs ~ jitter + shimmer + age + sex, data=data)
summary(multi_lm)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = total_updrs ~ jitter + shimmer + age + sex, data = data)

Residuals:

shimmer     13.07136    7.30299   1.790  0.07353 .  
age          0.36664    0.01508  24.319  < 2e-16 ***
```
